title: Trade ceasefire rally could be short-lived, market strategists warn
text: Trade truce headlines boosted stocks, but they are likely to be a short-lived positive since trade talks between the U.S. and China could drag on for months and result in more tariffs.

title: South East Asian Trade Smashed By Trade Tensions And A Faltering Chinese Economy
text: Nations in South East Asia are experiencing plunging trade and stumbling economies, analysts say, and they add it is due to a weakening Chinese economy and trade war tensions.

title: ISM Manufacturing Index Weakest In Nearly Three Years As New Orders Stall
text: The ISM manufacturing index fell to its worst levels since October 2016, but was better than expected. The new orders index fell to the break-even 50 level.

title: U.S. factory activity falls to more than two-and-a-half-year low
text: U.S. manufacturing activity hit more than a 2-1/2-year low in June, with a measure of new orders received by factories tumbling, amid growing anxiety over the escalation in trade tensions between the United States and China.

title: Iranian oil minister: Iran is not ready to talk to the US until sanctions are lifted
text: Iran is not ready to engage in talks with the United States until sanctions are lifted, an Iranian oil minister told CNBC on Monday.

title: Oil Higher Ahead Of This Week's OPEC Meeting
text: Brent and U.S. crude futures were each higher by more than 2% Monday morning ahead of expectations for OPEC to extend an oil output cut.

title: China trade truce makes a good deal less likely — here’s your stock-market game plan
text: Investors shouldn’t rule out the probability of no deal because Trump may decide to focus on the long-term good of the U.S.

title: OPEC agrees to extend oil supply cut by nine months: delegate
text: The Organization of the Petroleum Exporting Countries agreed on Monday to extend oil production cuts by nine months, an OPEC delegate said.

title: More than 8 million homeowners are leaving big money on the table by not refinancing
text: Mortgage rates have been on a roller coaster for the last year, but now they're sitting at the bottom of the track, and that is giving a major boost to the number of borrowers who can benefit from a refinance.

title: The Russian Tail Wags the OPEC Dog
text: This past Saturday at the G-20 meeting in Osaka, Russian President Vladimir Putin announced that Russia and Saudi Arabia had struck a deal to maintain their current output cuts at least until the end of this year and perhaps through the first quarter of next year.

title: GBP/USD Has Been Falling In Response To Weak UK Data And USD Strength
text: Brexit has been taking its toll on the UK economy – and it is yet to happen. Markit's manufacturing purchasing managers' indicator for June has dropped to 48 points from 49.4 in May and reflects a deeper contraction in the sector.

title: G-20 Recap: Trade Truce A Boost For The Market, Especially Chip Stocks
text: A thaw in U.S.-China trade relations is good news for American computer chip makers and was already boosting investor confidence abroad Monday.

title: Ripple Is Calm After Last Week's Storm; The Path Of Least Resistance Is Sideways
text: Ripple succumbed to acute losses towards the end of last week. While support was established at $0.3893 (Fib levels swing low), correction above $0.40 has not been able to clear the resistance at the 38.2% Fib retracement level taken between the last drop from $0.4946 to a low at $0.3893.

title: U.S.-China trade agreement takes little pressure off Fed to cut rates
text: An agreement by the United States and China to return to the negotiating table on trade is doing little to relieve pressure on the Federal Reserve to cut interest rates.

title: Bitcoin Correction In June Skyrocketed Above $10,000 Forming A New 2019 High Under $14,000
text: Bitcoin skyrocketed above $10,000 in June. The ballistic rise continued to new 2019 highs close to $14,000.

title: Analysts think global 5G smartphone shipments will overtake 4G in 2023
text: After years of buildup, 5G is finally here — albeit more as a trickle than a deluge. These things take time, of course.

title: Russia wants Iran to remain equal player in global energy market: Novak
text: Russian Energy Minister Alexander Novak said after meeting his Iranian counterpart Bijan Zanganeh in Vienna on Monday that Moscow was interested in Iran remaining an equal player in the global energy market, according to a statement released by the Russian energy ministry.

title: Russia cut June oil output by more than required in global pact
text: Russia reduced oil production in June by more than the amount agreed in a global deal to cut output, the energy minister and industry sources said on Monday, as the sector still felt the impact of a contaminated crude crisis that crippled exports.

title: Barkindo confident OPEC+ can achieve oil market stability
text: OPEC Secretary-General Mohammad Barkindo said on Monday he is confident that OPEC+ members will succeed in balancing oil production to guarantee market stability, Kuwait state news agency (KUNA) quoted him as saying.

title: Freight Slowdown Is A Terrible Sign For The Economy
text: Nowadays many goods are digital, delivered electronically. But we still need lots of physical stuff which must travel to the customer.

title: U.S., China trade talks on positive track: PBOC's Yi
text: Trade negotiations between China and the United States at a G20 meeting over the weekend went better than expected and provide a positive roadmap for further talks, People's Bank of China Governor Yi Gang said on Monday.

title: JPMorgan CEO Jamie Dimon: Student Loans Are "Irrational"
text: JPMorgan CEO Jamie Dimon says student lending in the U.S. has been a "disgrace.

title: Stock Futures: Chips Lead On China Trade War Truce, Dow Jones Soars 250 Points
text: Inphi and Caterpillar stock eyed early breakouts Monday as a China trade war truce sent chips, China names and Dow Jones stock futures sharply higher.

title: Explainer: What extra U.S. farm products could China buy?
text: China has agreed to make unspecified new purchases of farm products from the United States, President Donald Trump said after meeting his Chinese counterpart Xi Jinping in Japan.

title: Futures surge as U.S.-China restart trade talks
text: U.S. stock index futures rose sharply on Monday, with chipmakers making handsome gains, as trade tensions between the United States and China eased after both sides agreed to restart talks.

title: A start-up that is beating Wall Street's giants is searching for the next great quant trader
text: Coming from nowhere a few years ago, 118-person XTX Markets has steadily climbed the ranks of electronic market makers, displacing huge institutions in the process.

title: Trump official says eased Huawei restrictions only apply to widely available products
text: National Economic Council chairman Larry Kudlow said the Chinese company hasn't been granted "a general amnesty."

title: Housing Is Booming, But Investors Are Still Too Scared To Invest In It
text: The housing crash was perhaps the most financially disruptive event of the century. It caused a whole generation of folks to swear off housing as an investment.

title: Russia's Novak says all producers favor nine-month oil output deal extension
text: Russian Energy Minister Alexander Novak said on Monday that all OPEC and non-OPEC countries favored extending their global oil output deal by nine months under the same terms agreed in December.

title: Specialty insurer ProSight Global files for an IPO
text: ProSight Global  filed Monday for an initial pubic offering of stock, although details on how many shares will be sold or at what price have yet to be determined.

title: Iraq oil minister says OPEC members seek inventories control, market balance
text: Iraq's oil minister said on Monday that his government and the rest of OPEC seek to control global oil inventories and restore balance to the oil market, according to a ministry statement.

title: Dow Jones Futures Soar; Apple, Chips, Stock Market Rally Are Trump-Xi Meeting Winners
text: Stock futures: The Trump-Xi meeting and Huawei ban reprieve is good news for chips like Micron, Qualcomm, Intel, Broadcom, as well as Apple and broader stock market rally.

title: Oil firms as OPEC+ poised to extend supply cut
text: Oil prices were up on Monday as OPEC and its allies looked on track to extend supply cuts until at least the end of 2019 at their meeting in Vienna this week.

title: Factories faltered in June, trade truce fails to brighten outlook
text: Factory activity shrank across much of Europe and Asia in June as the simmering U.S.-China trade conflict put further strains on the manufacturing sector, keeping policymakers under pressure to deploy stronger steps to avert a global recession.

title: Stocks Surge Globally As Trade Truce Reverberates: Markets Wrap
text: Stocks rallied globally after the U.S. and China reached a truce in the trade war and agreed to resume talks toward a deal.

title: JP Morgan predicts US-China truce will keep investors optimistic for a couple months
text: Most stock markets in Asia Pacific climb on Monday after the U.S. and China agreed to hold off new tariffs.

title: Oil prices jump over 2% as OPEC set to extend supply cuts
text: Oil prices rose more than $1 a barrel on Monday, with OPEC and its allies on track to extend supply cuts until at least the end of 2019 at their meeting in Vienna this week.

title: Asia's factories falter in June, trade truce fails to brighten outlook
text: Factory activity shrank in most Asian countries in June as the simmering U.S.-China trade conflict put further strains on the region's manufacturing sector, keeping policymakers under pressure to deploy stronger steps to avert a global recession.

title: Stocks jump on trade reprieve, bonds reconsider rate cuts
text: Stocks rallied and bonds retreated in Asia on Monday as the United States and China agreed to restart trade talks, leading investors to pare wagers on aggressive policy easing by the major central banks.

title: Self-driving cars face two important challenges, says World Economic Forum executive
text: Autonomous driving companies need to make sure the technology works and that business models can actually make money, according to World Economic Forum's Michelle Avary.

title: OPEC set to extend oil supply cut as Iran endorses pact
text: OPEC and its allies look set to extend oil supply cuts this week at least until the end of 2019 as Iran joined top producers Saudi Arabia, Iraq and Russia in endorsing a policy aimed at propping up the price of crude amid a weakening global economy.

title: OPEC is sounding likely to extend oil production curbs as meeting starts in Vienna
text: Ahead of a meeting of OPEC and its allies in Vienna, the most important oil producers in attendance are indicating there's likely to be an extension of a deal to curb oil production.

title: As U.S. expansion notches record, recovery may have only just begun
text: A now record-setting run of U.S. economic growth enters its 121st month on Monday, sustained by a decade of low interest rates and massive Federal Reserve intervention that helped put 22 million people back to work.

title: The trade war hasn't stopped investors from buying Chinese shares, says UBS
text: Chinese stocks rose after U.S. President Donald Trump and Chinese President Xi Jinping agreed at the G-20 summit to pause the trade war.
